benchmark_details.name: REVAL (REliability and VALues)
benchmark_details.overview: REVAL is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate the Reliability and Values of large vision-language models (LVLMs), encompassing over 144K image-text Visual Question Answering (VQA) samples.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a robust framework for evaluating the reliability and ethical values of large vision-language models.

data.source: Self-constructed dataset and existing datasets like Dysca, VLBiasBench, and ToViLaG.
data.annotation: Manually annotated based on various evaluation criteria.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on normalized scores across various evaluation dimensions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values indicate better performance and ethical alignment.
methodology.validation: The benchmark's validity is tested through comparisons with existing benchmarks and assessments of multiple LVLMs.
